intro: Sisymbrium pusillum, commonly known as dwarf winter cress, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has pinnately lobed leaves and produces slender, cylindrical seed pods that split open to release tiny seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Sisymbrium pusillum is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize new habitats quickly.
